A service offered to help users carry out Heritage Science research activities, such as analysis, technical examination or access to archives and resources.

Such as all services offered in the current IPERION-HS catalogue of services.

column3:
A technique is the general classification of a given activity, ideally represented by an externally defined Vocabulary, and not the local name for a process. New and novel or combination techniques may need to have new classification terms defined for this field.

Optical Microscopy, OCT, Neutron Bean Analysis, Reading, RCA, etc.

An actor is an institution, group or individual involved in a given event.

Service providers, researchers, users, etc.

The organisation, initiative or source of funds that directly covers the costs or the resources required for a given service or examination.
IPERION-HS, E-RIHS, National Research Initiatives, Self Funding, etc.

A Project or Access is a planed series of activities and results focused on a defined research question or set of questions.

The study of the materials used by a given artist, identifying the composition of a specific object, exploring degredation processes, researching past activities, etc.

An examination or measurement event designed to generate new knowledge.

Examinations can range from studying a sample in a synchrotron, technical imaging or even personal examinations of resources in an Archive.
